poem:
Title: In Contrast to Dreamtime 

Bedtime in the West, weight of the world.
In Manchester, a cradled moment;
Gaza's image, hauntingly unfurled.
Mothers whisper lullabies, laments.

Rocks not cradles, tales of dread,
Innocence on the battlefield:
An echo of a child's bed,
Where only dreams should wield.

East to West, mother's song begs,
For tomorrow's sunrise, let the horror cease.
